Sentencas: In current work, we conducted comparative studies of electrolyte-supported and anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells by means of electrochemical techniques (studies of I-V curves and impedance spectroscopy) as well as using Raman spectroscopy from the inner interface of the anode electrode and solid electrolyte.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Electrolyte-supported (ESC) SOFCs were based on thick single-crystalline 8YSZ anion conductor membrane and had multilayered composite electrodes.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Anode-supported cells (ASC) were based on thick two-layered commercially available anode supports, the thin-film electrolyte was deposited using a magnetron sputtering technique.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Comparative studies showed a significant dependence of 460 cm(-1)
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Raman peak both on fuel mixture composition and current load applied to the cell.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Linear dependences of OCV on normalized peak area gave an opportunity to estimate local anodic overpotential on the current load applied for both SOFC structures.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Application of ASC model cells gave an opportunity to significantly extend a range of current loads applied.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes

Sentencas: Analysis of impedance spectra gave the opportunity to study the structure of complex resistance as well as the structure of local anodic overpotential obtained.
Titulo: Comparison of in-situ Raman studies of SOFC with thick single-crystal and thin-film magnetron sputtered membranes
